bibl.title: Literacy and Luxury in the Early Empire: A Papyrus-roll Winder from Pompeii.
bibl.note: Naples, National Museum of Archaeology, Acc. 109905 A-B. Ivory plaques carved on both sides (measurements unknown), probably designed to hold open a book roll. Most of the 8 surviving examples are in ivory. They apparently belonged to women.
bibl.seg: WOOD Susan, Literacy and Luxury in the Early Empire: A Papyrus-roll Winder from Pompeii.

Naples, National Museum of Archaeology, Acc. 109905 A-B. Ivory plaques carved on both sides (measurements unknown), probably designed to hold open a book roll. Most of the 8 surviving examples are in ivory. They apparently belonged to women.
